title: Luciano Chessa: Music the dead can hear - Occult presences in Luigi Russolo's Art of Noises (Histories and Theories of Sound)
itunes:author: Liquid Architecture
itunes:subtitle: Histories and Theories of Sound
itunes:summary:
Luciano Chessa examines the work of Italian Futurist, painter and musician Luigi Russolo, presenting a reading of the mechanical sound synthesizers, the intonarumori, that he began to create in 1913. It traces the roots of Russolo’s instrument to Leonardo da Vinci’s noisemakers, and then reestablishes the previously unacknowledged prominence of occultism, including theosophy, in early twentieth-century Italian culture.
